trans-unit.source: Represents a 2-D skew.
A <xref:System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform> is useful for creating the illusion of 3-dimensional depth in a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_2d](~/includes/tlasharptla-2d-md.md)] object.

**Freezable Features:** Because it inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> class, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform> class provides several special features: <xref:System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform> objects can be declared as , shared among multiple objects, made read-only to improve performance, cloned, and made thread-safe.
For more information about the different features provided by <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects, see [Freezable Objects Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/freezable-objects-overview.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform"></xref> class that has the specified x- and y-axes angles and is centered on the origin.
The x-axis skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis.
For more information, see the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.AngleX"></xref> property.
The y-axis skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the x-axis.
For more information, see the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.AngleY"></xref> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform"></xref> class that has the specified x- and y-axes angles and center.
The x-axis skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis.
For more information, see the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.AngleX"></xref> property.
The y-axis skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the x-axis.
For more information, see the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.AngleY"></xref> property.
The x-coordinate of the transform center.
For more information, see the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.CenterX"></xref> property.
The y-coordinate of the transform center.
For more information, see the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.CenterY"></xref> property.
Gets or sets the x-axis skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis.
To skew an object in place, set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.CenterX%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.CenterY%2A> properties to the object's center point.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis.
The default is 0.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.AngleX"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the y-axis skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the x-axis.
To skew an object in place, set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.CenterX%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.CenterY%2A> properties to the object's center point.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The skew angle, which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the x-axis.
The default is 0.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.AngleY"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the x-coordinate of the transform center.
To skew an object in place, set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.CenterX%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.CenterY%2A> properties to the object's center point.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The x-coordinate of the transform center.
The default is 0.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.CenterX"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the y-coordinate of the transform center.
To skew an object in place, set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.CenterX%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.CenterY%2A> properties to the object's center point.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The y-coordinate of the transform center.
The default is 0.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform.CenterY"></xref> dependency property.
Creates a modifiable copy of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform"></xref> by making deep copies of its values.
Use this method to produce modifiable copies of read-only <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects.
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
When this method copies dependency properties, it copies resource references and data bindings although they might no longer resolve.
It does not copy animations or their current values.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable deep copy of the current object.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property of the cloned object returns `false` even if the <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property of the source is `true.`
Creates a modifiable copy of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform"></xref> object by making deep copies of its values.
This method does not copy resource references, data bindings, or animations, although it does copy their current values.
Use this method to produce modifiable copies of read-only <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects.
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable deep copy of the current object.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property of the cloned object is `false` even if the <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property of the source is `true`.
Gets the current transformation value as a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref>.
The current skewing transformation value as a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref>.
